item.title: Bulgaria ditches budget plan after tens of thousands join protests
item.description: Demonstrators said the plan - the country's first in euros - attempted to hide widespread government corruption.

item.title: South African radio DJ among five charged over Russia recruitment plot
item.description: The group has been charged under a law which prohibits people from joining foreign armies.

item.title: India tells smartphone makers to put state-run cyber safety app on new devices
item.description: India wants all smartphone makers to pre-install new devices with a state-owned cyber security app.

item.title: 'Hung by my wrists and beaten': Israeli-Russian woman says Iraqi militants tortured her in captivity
item.description: Elizabeth Tsurkov, who was freed in September, tells the BBC that her two years in captivity left her physically and mentally scarred.

item.title: US Navy admiral ordered second deadly Venezuela boat strike, White House says
item.description: The strikes, authorised by Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth, have raised fresh legality questions - but the White House says laws have been followed.
